Q5.A: The presented lear graph illustrates the data about the number of gyms and the number of members in my city over the past decade. People are nowadays very concerned about their health and this is the reason of many people going to gyms. The highest number of gyms were opened up in the year 2018. This year marks the upward trend regarding gymming. The same number of people joined the gyms in that particular year. It is followed by the year 2016 when around 4000 people joune gyms were opened and around 3000 pe members joined. And then comes the third highest year 2022 & where around the same number of gyms were opened and the members joined. The given data shows that opening of gyms, followed an upward trend from year 2010 to 2016 and then took a jump in 2018 which was followed by a fall in 2020 due to the covid pandemic. People are again getting cautious about their health and doing more physical activities in gyms which leads to the opening of more gyms and jousing of more members in 2020

B.i: (B) sympathetic, understanding the depth of the boy's loss
B.ii: 'Ball' is used as a metaphor in the above extract. Ball, here, symbolises the child's innocence and his childhood memories hich he had lost and is now gaining maturity chile sensing his responsibilities.
B.iii: 'All his young days into the harbour' refers to the boy's memories. The harbour reminds the boy of his young days when he used to play with his ball which was now lost into the harbour. The harbour is triggering the memories of his young days and the ball.
B.iv: The boy's journey from 'shaking grief' to 'he is learning' represents his journey from his young innocent days towards his maturity along with his responsibilities. The boy first, feels despondent and ultimate grief on losing the ball which leaves him stationery and rigid. Soon, he realizes his responsibility of losing things in this materialistic world. He is learning that money cannot buy back his memories but could only buy materialistic things.

Q8.i: 'Dust of snow' is a beautiful poem written by 'Robert Frost' illustrating the beauty of nature. Initially in the poem, the poet heas feeling melancholic and highly despondent. He was wasting his time in grief. The images of crow hemlock tree and snow has been used by the poet for positive effect. Though these images are seen as harbingers of doom and bad omen, the poet uses them as a catylyst catalyst for positive change. The falling of snow from a hemlock tree that too by action of a crow, makes the poet happy for the rest of the day. This shows that whatever the event may le, our response to it matters.
Q8.iii: Though Custard in the poem by 'Ogden Nash' was initially thought to be a coward dragon, but to the contrary custard had all the traits of a dragon that makes it look scary and fearsome. Custard has spikes on his back and scales underneath. He could bring out fire from his mouth. He heas a huge dragon with shary sharp teeth with which he ate the pirate. His sharp spikes, huge body, fire from the mouth, sharp claves which were compared to daggers and the smoke enitting out of his hose, all make him a fearsome and scary dragon.
Q8.iv: The poem "For Anne Gregory" is a poem by 'William Butler Yeats', signifying that everyone except God love people for only the outer appearance. but not their inner beauty The speaker mentions God in the poem to give it a Spiritual dimension. The speaker says that he met a man who said that only divine love, that is, the type of love shown by yod is the only form of love that is free from the glamour and outer beauty. God love people for their inner beauty and not like people who are tempted towards the outer glamour, show and shine
Q8.v: Gautama Buddha's story stands true for each and every person on this earth regardless of their social and political status. The people in positions and power think themselves as the rulers of the world But they forget that whoever has taken ber birth on this earth has to die one day. Humans are mortal. All their power, position as well as wealth will be left behind once they die. Buddha believes that only good deeds of a person remains with him always. According to Buddha, we should not be self-centered in our life because this is the truth of life that no one can escape the cycle of life. wise people are those who do not grieve.

Q9.i: It is rightly said that 'scientists contribute to nake the world a better place to live. But Griffin, on the contrary, was an antithesis to this statement Griffin discovered a rare drug that could make people invisible He took that drug to become invisible Griffin was a brilliant scientist leut he heas not a good person. His invention could be used to help his country as well as to bring fame for himself but he did not use it the right neay. Patience would have been an asset for Griffin as would have common sense! Griffin heas a scientist as well as a person prone to anger which proved to be a dangerous combination for him as well as the people around him.
Q9.ii: Bhali's teacher felt like an artist admiring her masterpiece. This statement holds true according to the story of Bholi Bholi was like a dumb cove she used to stammer and was ugly with pock marks on her face. Luckily, she was sent to school on the demand of the Tehsildar. St school, it was Bholi's teacher who helped her gain confidence. When Bholi heas being married off to an old man she did not say anything. But when the old man demanded dowry, she heas against it and spoke against it infront of everyone. Everyone was shocked to hear Bholi speaking without stammering. Her teacher played a crucial role in transforming her Her teacher neas proud that Bholi chose to live a dignified life rather than surrendering herset herself to a greedy man. It was Bholi's teacher who helped her transform frons a dumb cow to a confident woman, that is, from Bholi - the simpleton to 'Sulekha.

Q10.i: Childhood memories remind us of the days gone by. Memories help us to relive our young days. But, not everyone wants to remember their past, maybe because of the hardships they faced. Childhood of narrator in you. The narrator had a beautiful and a wouth remembering childhood in you. The sound of the leaker's bamboo made him wake up and rush tonwards them. The narrator still remembers the beautiful smell of the breads and cakes which he heas fond of. The narrator shares beautiful memories of his past, and also about the breads of you. Childhood of Nelson Mandela. Nelson Mandela thought his childhood to be free free but the freedom he experienced was as go just an illusion for the members of his race. He had spent his childhood in one of the most harshest and inhumane societies of the world They were treated as slaves. There was raciat donmination of dark skinned people in their own land. Comparision From the lives of both the narrators, we come to know that the narrator in youa had enjoyed his childhood days and were free to do whatever he wanted whereas Nelson Mandela sufferred from racial discrimination and spent his life fighting for equal rights. While the narrator of 's Baker in you' has sweet memories which everyone would want to live, on the contrary, Nelson Mandela faced many hardships and challenges in his life. No one would like to remember such a harsh past in their lives.

Q11.ii: 'The Thief's story' is an amazing story which shows us the importance of trust and values. Idari Singh was a thief. He started living at Anil's house to nob him. He befriended Anil and soon gained his trust. when snil got a payment of six hundred rupes, he kept it under his mattress. At night while snil neas sleeping Hari Singh slipped his hand under the ta mattress. and stole the money. But he could not run for heith the money. His conscience pricked him as he did not heant to break Anil's trust. He felt guilty and came back home with the money which by then had been damp due to rain. He put the soggy notes back at the place from where he retrieved it snil, the next day, on knowing everything didn't react Even on knowing about this incidence, he accepted Hari with open hands. This shows us the importance of values. Values can even change a lead person. Sympathy, education and good behaviour are capable of changing a criminal into a good person. Though circumstances made I Hari a criminal, Snil in understood his position and decided to educate him. It was Anil's trust and good behaviour which brought Hari back on the good path. Thus the statement, Anil successfully addressed the situation by not addressing it at all.
